title: HTML Text Elements
info:
In HTML, headings are the titles or subtitles that a programmer wants to have displayed on a webpage. HTML headings are defined with tags. These tags can range from

to

. The

heading is the largest, top level, or most important heading. The

heading is the smallest, lowest level, or least important heading.

I'm big!

I'm small!

Headings are important for a variety of reasons. For example, search engines parse headings to identify a web page’s structure. Search engines also use headings to catalog the content of a web page. A web page’s reader also uses headings, often as a way to identify organization, structure, and content of a webpage.
You can also create bold and italic texts in HTML. Use the element to create bold text that stands out. I'm bold! Use the element to create italicized text. I'm italicized!
